dialogues.speaker: INT. OSCAR'S APARTMENT- BEDROOOM- NIGHT
dialogues.text: We open on an expensive looking flip cellphone sitting on dresser. Next to it, a large zip lock bag of marijuana. W stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your resolution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna cut carbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trippin. You look fine. Plus you Mexican. You cut carbs and you can't eat nothin yo grandma cooks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK YOU...You just gotta help me stick to it. It only takes 30 days to form a habit. Then it becomes second nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Oprah Oscar laughs hard at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna quit selling trees.                           The PHONE VIBRATES and RINGS "MARCUS CALLING" shows on th outer screen. Oscar's moves towards the cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osc. Oscar stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go out there tonight, stay home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna give me a reason to? Sophina doesn't answer. The phone rings again. Oscar's ha quickly picks it up and flips it open. We follow the phon his face and we see him for the first time, a 22 year old Black man with a warm smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye bruh it's bad tonight. I gotta catch you tomorrow. He closes it before the guy on the other end can respond. takes the phone with him as he climbs back into bed with SOPHINA MESA, a curvy 24 year old Mexican American woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not going out, you happy now? Sophina nods. Oscar moves closer to her and kisses her on neck. She kisses him back a bit, then scoots away. Oscar kisses her again. Puts his hand in her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osc. Osc, hold up. Oscar stops. Sophina scoots away even further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, wussup? I been home hella long...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...Every time you touch me, I can't help to think about how you was touchin that Bitch. Oscar shakes his head at this, sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? You right, go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I gotta do? I'm here, right now. I fucked up one time, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you fucking got caught, one time. You gonna sit here and tell me that was the first time you kicked it with that Bitch. Never seen her before that huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look I'm done with that shit. All I want is you and T, forever. Sophina looks at him, searching for the truth in his eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you mean, forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you. Oscar kisses her, moves in. Sophina scoots away from him. KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK. Oscar and Sophina look over at the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy. Oscar looks at Sophina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She's askin for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to child)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, T. Oscar jumps up and grabs the bag of weed off of the dress and hides it in the closet. He rushes over and opens the door where we see TATIANA GR a cute 4 year old girl, standing wearing footie pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sleep... Before Tatiana can even finish, Oscar has her in his arms brings her over to the bed and places her next to Sophina

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to sleep in here with Mommy and Daddy? Tatiana nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know better than that T. (to Oscar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it? Oscar picks up his phone and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, it's after midnight. He opens his phone up. Presses compose text message (as h types the message, the words appear as graphics across th screen like Sub Titles)

dialogues.speaker: HAPPY BIRTHDAY
dialogues.text: Oscar sends the text off. He hooks his phone up to the charger and hits the light switch, leaving us in darkness

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wussup, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to move to Livermore. Oscar and Sophina laugh at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hella nosy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry T, aint nobody's moving right now. Go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OSCAR'S APARTMENT- BATHROOM- DAY
dialogues.text: Oscar stands in the shower, letting the water run over hi head. There looks to be a lot on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OSCAR'S APARTMENT- KITCHEN- DAY
dialogues.text: Sophina and Oscar move around the small kitchen like a we oiled machine. Sophina, wearing a WalMart uniform, makes lunches. Oscar wipes milk from Tatiana's face and fixes h hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy can I have two of the fruit snacks today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, T. You can take an extra apple if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But mommy I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't argue T. Tatiana pouts. Sophina downs a cup full of orange juice, grabs both lunch bags, Tatiana, and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Com'on Osc. We gotta stop and get gas too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got enough to get yall there. Sophina shoots Oscar a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go start the car up. You got your keys?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sophina nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. I gotta grab my beanie. Sophina and Tatiana leave. Oscar watches them go for a be He turns to the cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FIRST FRUIT LEARNING CENTER- DAY
dialogues.text: Oscar and Tatiana walk to the downstairs entrance of a tw story house. A picture of an apple tree is painted next t the door. Oscar squats down to her level and brushes down frizz in her hair. He looks back at the car. We see that Sophina is adjusting her make up in the fold mirror. Oscar turns to Tatiana. He then takes her hand, and place something inside of it. Tatiana looks down into her hand and we see that it is a small bag of fruit snacks. She looks up at Oscar with a bright eyed expression. But Oscar quickly places his fing over his lips. Tatiana nods in agreement, trying to hold back a huge smi She gives him a swift kiss on the cheek. He stands up and knocks on the front door. MRS. STACY a motherly looking Black woman in her 50's ope the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning Tatiana!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning Mrs. Stacy. Tatiana heads into the house. Oscar smiles at Mrs. Stacey, and she nods back. He watche Tatiana run off into house.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SOPHINA'S CAR- WALMART PARKING LOT- DAY
dialogues.text: Oscar and Sophina look on at the WAL MART Entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Told you we'd make it. The light aint even on yet. She looks at the dashboard where there is a PICTURE of Os holding Tatiana tucked in the glass. The fuel gage sits almost under E, but the light still isn't on. She stares at the store entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna go home and sleep, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, Imma go up to the job. Get some stuff for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. I'd rather die than come here on my day off. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time we supposed to be at your grandma's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prolly like seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gonna go to Frisco again? Catch the fireworks? Oscar nods. Sophina smiles at the idea of Frisco, for a b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get in here.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She quickly sits up. Oscar leans over to give her a kiss the cheek, makes a farting sound on her neck instead. Sophina chuckles at this as she gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you too. SLAM! Sophina shuts the door on him. Oscar laughs. His sm fades, as he watches her go inside.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SOPHINA'S CAR- DAY
dialogues.text: Oscar, now in the car by himself rides in the car listeni to HIP HOP MUSIC. He comes to a red light. He looks at the car radio clock: 8:58 AM. He thinks to himself for a beat, he looks dissatisfied. H turns his music up for a beat and listens to it. He looks around, still not at ease. He turns off his music and pul out his cellphone. He takes a quick look around to see wh cars are around, before dialing numbers. CALLING MOM flas on the screen. He holds the phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. UPS WAREHOUSE ENTRANCE- DAY
dialogues.text: A beautiful Black woman in her late 40's wears a UPS manager's uniform, this is WANDA JOHNSON. She walks towar the entrance of her store, when her cellphone rings in he purse. She pulls it out, stressed. Answers it without looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last shot right here, you sure you want to work on your birthday? You still got time to catch a cold... Wanda's face brightens up with a familiar looking smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Son! Thanks for the text last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. Come on, let's go celebrate right now.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wanda laughs at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As tempting as that sounds... this place would be a mess without me today. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We close early though...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...You still want me to get a couple crabs, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and can you pick some... are you driving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wearing your earpiece? Oscar hesitates for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me. That's all you need is to get pulled over right now. Put your earpiece on, Oscar. Oscar sighs... this is nothing new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. He pulls the car over. He looks around for his earpiece for beat- no luck. He ta his cellphone, and slides it into the elastic of his bean a poor man's Bluetooth. He pulls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay pick up a couple of packets of dried shrimp too. Come by on your way, I'll give you the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah Ma, it's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright I'll pay you back tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, don't trip off that. I got you. Wanda pauses for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so you're buying this, with Farmer Joe's money... right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ye-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's the only kind of money you have right now... right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah Ma, and I'm gonna use my discount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well let me run in here. I'll see you later tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanda hangs up the phone. She looks at it for a beat. The puts it back in her purse and heads into the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FARMER JOE'S PARKING LOT- DAY- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: We see the entrance of Farmer Joe's, and shoppers coming and out. Oscar looks around for a beat, and takes off his hoody, and puts it into his back pocket. We follow him in

dialogues.speaker: INT. FARMER JOE'S- DAY- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: It is a moderately sized grocery store, but several SHOPP move about the aisles. Oscar walks over to the seafood section where Cato CALDWELL, a 22 year old charismatic Bl male stands behind the counter wearing a Deli apron. Cato sees Oscar and smiles brightly. He takes a pile of f off the scale, bags it, ands it to an older BLACK WOMAN. takes off his clear glove and slaps hands with Oscar over counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sup Osc, bruh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. What's good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lookin for Emi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He here today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah he is. He was just over here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cato looks around at the surrounding aisles. No signs of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to get some crabs too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, tell Moms I said Happy Birthday. I had meant to call her this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should come through grandma house tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruh I wish I could, but I gotta bust a couple moves tonight. What's good for the countdown though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frisco. Fireworks and the whole shit- Oscar sees something out of the corner of his eye. He mot his head for Cato to look. Cato turns and sees- KATIE, a White girl in her mid 20's, playing with her iPh while waiting for help. Cato quickly makes his way over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah... I want to get a pound of, wait... Can I see what your sole looks like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sole? Cato takes a sidestep over to his left and motions to a p of fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, wait. Your catfish. Let me see what that looks like.... Cato points to the catfish. Katie looks at it, then looks down to her phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay but, I want to fry it. Like a fish fry. Are these the ones you can fry? Cato gives her an "are you serious?" look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)                            14A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every fish we sell here can be fried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Katie looks at him, still flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let me have a second. She looks back down at her iPhone, and takes a step back. Cato turns to Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you need for moms, bruh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get three Dungeness. Cato nods and walks over to the crab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat ones too, bruh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet. Oscar turns to Katie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your family having a fish fry for New Years or something? Katie looks up from her phone, a bit caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, yeah. Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool. I work here. She looks at Oscar suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my day off. Katie smiles nervously. Looks at Cato who nods at Katie i approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm cooking dinner tonight for my friend, before we go to the city. And he really likes fried fish, like southern style. And I maybe lied a bit, and said that I know how to cook like that. Oscar laughs at this. Katie shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he black?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boyfriend. Katie blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's white. But he knows a lot of black people... He's not my boyfriend either... Oscar chuckles at this.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Katie looks down at her phone again. She uses her fingers zoom in on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what type of fish he wants. And most of these recipes are different on this site. Oscar watches her with a look of pity. Suddenly, an idea flashes before his eyes. He pulls out his cellphone, quickly dials a number, and h it to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see GRANDMA BONNIE, a black woman in her early 70's , putting flowers into a vase on her kitchen counter. A cordless phone RINGS on the counter. She looks at the p for a beat then she cheers up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar holds his cellphone and snaps at Katie to get her attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar? What's going on Baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at my job, and this girl here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say you're at work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy you know better than to be talking on the phone while you're at work! Bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma, Grandma, I'm off today. I'm just shopping for the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I thought you were up there playing on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw grandma. But I got this girl here, she wants to fry fish for her boyfriend, but she don't know how. You think you could tell her what she needs to know and everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no problem, baby. What kind of fish does she want to fry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Katie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What type of F--, wait.. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you mean she don't know? Put her on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Oscar holds out the phone for Katie. She reaches out apprehensively. He gives her a reassuring look. She takes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma Bonnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello, Grandma Bonnie, it's Katie, Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie smiles and blocks her other ear to hear better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pssst!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar snaps his head to Cato, who motions for Oscar to lo down the aisle. Oscar looks over and sees, EMI, a thirtysomething Hispani man wearing a white collared shirt and a name tag. He che the shelves with a barcode scanning device. Oscar slowly heads over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Emi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar, what's going on??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to grab some stuff for my Mom's birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you found everything that you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emi turns and starts for the next aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emi, hold up man, I wanted to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little nuts right now, holiday and all. But what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need my job back. I need my job back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Position's been filled. Take care man. Emi turns to head down the aisle, Oscar reaches out and g Emi by his sleeve. Emi stops and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I was going through some shit, trying to get back on my feet. But I need this job man. I'll show up early every day. You can start me back off with one shift a week or whatever. I'm here. You can work me 40 hours a week and pay me for 20. I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar, dude. I hired somebody else. For me to hire you back, that means I have to let someone else go. Someone with no felonies. Who's never showed up late once. I like you man, but I can't do that. I'm sorry. If something else opens up, maybe I'll let you know. Take care of yourself. Emi walks away. Oscar watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Oscar turns around to find Katie, holding out his phone f him to take. Oscar looks at her basket, it's now full of and supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you got enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, Your grandmother is so sweet! I can't believe she was kind enough to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. She's happy to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)                                  22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much... Katie by the way. She extends her hand to shake with Oscar. Oscar smiles, shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar... like the Grouch!! Oscar shakes his head at this. Katie starts off towards t register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care. Oscar's nods. He walks back over to Cato, who is weighing fish for another CUSTOMER. He spots Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How it go? Oscar smiles wide and nods. He reaches over the counter a grabs the bag of crabs, then bumps fists with Cato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wussup bruh! Imma hit you tonight! Yall can ride with me. Oscar nods and heads towards the checkout line, his smile fading.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OSCAR'S HOUSE KITCHEN- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Oscar places the bag of crabs in the refrigerator. He clo it and looks at the refrigerator for a beat. On it we see several drawings done by Tatiana held on the door by magn Oscar smiles at these. His phone rings: BIG SIS CALLING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chantay, a 25 year old Black woman, wearing a KFC employe uniform pinches a cellphone between her ear and her shoul She organizes papers in a folder while she talks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, chump! What you doin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the house, just got back from the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were off today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... You call mom yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh okay. I got good news and bad news. Oscar thinks for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad news first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need help with the rent for this month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like $300. I'll get you back in a couple of weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. What's the good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working overtime tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That's fucking bad news too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's not. Double time and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Chantay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, gotta do it. Moms understands. But I need you to get her a card and sign it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Osc, don't get me a fake ass card with white people on it. I want a black card. And not one of those joke cards either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aight. I got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Oscar, love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you too, scrub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. Oscar closes his phone. Thinks to himself for a beat. He opens his phone back up and punches some numbers. Calling Marcus flashes across the screen.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BARBER SHOP- DAY
dialogues.text: MARCUS, a tough looking Asian- American man about Oscar's sits in a barber's chair, A Black BARBER cuts his hair. H phone vibrates in his pocket, and the Barber steps back t let him answer it. He pulls out an iPhone and talks into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wussup wit it, Osc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wussup bruh? My bad about last night. You still tryna get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I aint out that way. Imma be in the Town all day. Oscar takes a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit bruh I can come to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Meet me over there by the water bruh. Right off of 80. I'll be over there in like a hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aight, bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet. Oscar hangs up his phone. Green (7/5/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar quickly walks over to his closet and grabs the bag weed. He neatens up the room a bit, and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLMARK STORE- DAY
dialogues.text: The store is small and brightly lit. Oscar is reading a c from off the BIRTHDAY FOR MOTHER rack. We see that on the card is a picture of a black woman wal on the beach holding her son's hand. Inscribed over it ar the words to the religious poem "Footsteps" by Anonymous. Oscar's eyes quickly scan the poem: he's read it before. Oscar opens the card, and looks inside for a beat. He loo up, moved by the words. He stares off into space.

dialogues.speaker: TEN MONTHS EARLIER
dialogues.text: We look through a foggy window at Wanda sitting at one of several large wooden tables with plastic chairs placed ar them. There are a few VISITORS already sitting at tables inmates. Several Corrections Officers stand by. We see Oscar, shirtless, arms behind his head, is looking through the glass window of the search room. A Correction Officer is conducting a search. Oscar's face is bruised u his left eye, and there is a small white bandage strip on left side of his face. He turns around, bends over and coughs. He turns back around, and the officer hands him h Blue shirt and pants. Oscar puts them on and- BUZZ. The door opens, and Oscar walks through the large r to Wanda's table. As he approaches she stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Ma. Oscar gives her a hug, leaning across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look nice. Wanda shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girls come over last night? Wanda nods. Laughs a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We played board games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Candyland"? Wanda nods. Laughing a bit more now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yall let her win too, I bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yall hella weak for that. She gets no easy victories with me around. Oscar smiles and notices Wanda is smiling about something her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember that microwave popcorn you bought a while back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the kettle corn. Hella good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, kettle corn. I popped some of that for us, and I was putting it into a bowl. Tatiana's looking up at me, like she wants something. Wanda starts to chuckle a bit again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. What she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at me and says,"Grandma, do we have any dark butter?" Oscar looks at Wanda with a confused look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark butter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm thinking she saw "Food Network" or something. So I say, "what's dark butter sweetheart?" She says, "When Daddy took me to see WALL.E he asked for light butter, so I want to try some dark butter this time." Oscar looks at Wanda with a bright eyed expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is gettin way too smart. Another BUZZ from the door is heard.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As the two share a moment, DANIEL CALE, a stocky white in in his early 30's walks past Oscar and Wanda's table. He a large, square bandage under his left eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just loud enough for Oscar to hear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This moms right here? Anger flashes over Oscar's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She a snitch to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What the Fuck you say about my Mom bruh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you and that bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tough in here with these guards huh? Two Corrections Officers move quickly over to Oscar's tab Cale, continues to walk towards a the table with the Woma and the Frizzy Haired Girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, we good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my best friend right there. Cale flashes a mischievous smile. The Corrections Officer comes over and stands between the two. Oscar watches as Cale sits down across from the woman, wh holds the baby. Cale smiles at the woman, and makes cooch coo faces at the baby.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Woman passes the child to Cale over the table. Oscar looks on with malice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar, Calm down. Wanda's voice snaps the anger off of his face. He looks back to Wanda, and his anger subsides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark butter huh? She always listening. Wanda stares at Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She too smart for her own good man. The preschool said we should think about starting her in school early. Phina tell you that? Wanda doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're gonna put her in private school. I was lookin at St. Bede the other day. It's this other school that starts them off learning Spanish, then it gradually gets them back going on English. It's like a new thing-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming to see you anymore. Oscar stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming here, to these visits anymore. This is the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)                                  31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I know I know. This is my last time too. I told you that. I ain't goin down no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to keep putting Sophina through this... go ahead. But Tatiana doesn't deserve this. She didn't have a choice. Oscar takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She too young to know what's going on right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's why she asked me why you love taking your vacations more than being with her. Oscar cut his eyes from Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She aint say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm the liar now. Oscar takes a beat to think about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her that I love her more than anything in the world. And that I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her yourself. Next time you call. Tell your daughter how much you love her over the phone. Or better yet, just let her come visit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want her to see me like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is how you are right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want her to be exposed to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already exposed her to it! Wanda leans back in her chair- she's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you really not gonna visit me no more? I got four more months!! Oscar leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, this shit aint like Rita. It's crazy in here. I don't know if I can make it without you seeing you that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you Oscar, I'm praying for you, and I'll see you when you get home. Wanda scoots back in her chair, stands up, and heads towa the exit.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Oscar remains seated in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, hold up. Let me get a hug. Wanda continues to walk. Oscar stands up, and follows beh Wanda. His feet pass a yellow line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma! Wanda continues on, not turning around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma! Hold up! The C.O. sees this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, back in your assigned visiting area. Oscar ignores him, and continues to follow his Mom. The C.O. hits a button on his walkie, and motions to the other C.O.'s. They quickly move towards Oscar and attempt grab him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off me! Oscar jerks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma! The C.O.'s grab Oscar and lift him up off of the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me! Ma! Ma! Wanda continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma. Ma! Hold up! (to C.O.'s)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me just give her a hug right quick before she leave! We pull back with Wanda as she walks away, trying to hide pain. Another Corrections Officer sprints past her toward Oscar, who we can still see in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma! Ma! (to the C.O.s)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off me! (to Wanda)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma! Ma! Oscar looks on at Wanda as she leaves, growing small in t distance.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLMARK STORE- DAY- PRESENT
dialogues.text: Oscar still stares off into space, moved by this memory. snaps out of it, heads towards the register with the card hand.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SOPHINA'S CAR- DAY
dialogues.text: Oscar starts the car up, looks at his dashboard. He sees the fuel light is on. Pink (6/25/2012)                                      35-

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GAS STATION- DAY
dialogues.text: Oscar pumps his gas. He looks at a poster of Obama that r CHANGE, posted on the gas pump. He looks across the lot a notices a Zales engagement ring poster. He pulls out his phone. Starts to text.

dialogues.speaker: LUNCH BREAK
dialogues.text: He sends it off. Closes, waits for a bit. It buzzes. He o it.

dialogues.speaker: ALREADY TOOK IT.
dialogues.text: Oscar puts his phone back into his pocket. He turns and begins to pump his gas. He sets the handle to automatical pump, and looks up and notices something.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We see it is a gnarly- looking male PIT BULL sniffing aro a few feet from Oscar's tires. It looks to be maybe 3 or years old. Oscar whistles at the dog and calls him over. Oscar pets him on the head, we see its ears are a bit scarred, but it has beautiful brown eyes. He feels around dog's neck- no collar. Oscar looks around for an owner fo beat while the dog licks his hand. CLICK- Oscar's gas tank is full. He turns away from the d places the pump back on the base, and screws his fuel cap back in. He looks back to where the dog was and doesn't s him. He scans the block and panic strikes his face. He ta off running towards the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! No, No, No Stop! SCHREECH... BAM! We hear it before we see it. A sickening sound. An animal YELPS, a car SPEEDS OFF. Oscar runs into street chasing a car going too fast for us to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Stop you bitch ass Muthafucka!! He stops, turns around, and runs over to something lying the street. It's the dog, and he's in bad shape. Oscar pi the dog up out of the street, and places him on the sidew

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come'on boy. Come on. The dog's breathing grows more struggled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody help! Somebody fucking Help!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Oscar continues to pet his head. The dog starts to violen shake... He becomes unnaturally still. Oscar stares at the Dog for a long beat, shaken up by thi He looks around, no one seems to have noticed. He bends down, closes the Dog's eyes, and heads for his c

dialogues.speaker: EXT. POINT EMERY- PARKING LOT- DAY
dialogues.text: It is an empty parking lot next to a beautiful view of th Bay. Oscar's car pulls up. After a short beat. A Lexus pu up along side of it. Marcus hops out of the Lexus and wal over to Oscar's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar leans over and opens the passenger side door for Ma to get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit bruh I didn't think we was ever gonna link up. You been good? Oscar stares out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got good news and bad news my nigg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awww naw, Osc bruh, don't tell me you aint got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sold it to a white boy bruh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awww Osc. For how much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gave me a rack for it. Marcus makes a face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way I was goin that high. Shit bruh. I needed that though... What's the good news? Oscar turns to Marcus hands him a brown pre- rolled joint

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your troubles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on Osc bruh. He pulls out a wad of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good bruh. Take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? Oscar nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on bruh. Marcus pulls out a lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burn one with ya boy right quick. Marcus lights up the joint, takes a hit, holds it out for Oscar, but Oscar just stares out of the Window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good, that's all you bruh. Marcus puts it back into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on Osc, then bruh. They slap hands, and Marcus gets out of the car. We hear get into his car, and start his car up. Oscar waits for a beat. He then reaches under his seat and grabs something.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. POINT EMERY- SHORELINE- DAY
dialogues.text: Oscar walks out onto the shoreline, looking at the water. looks around for a beat. He walks all the way out into th water. Standing on rocks.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks over both shoulders, to make sure no one is watching. He then goes into his waistband and pulls out t Ziplock bag of weed. He squats down, opens the bag, and d it into the water. He watches as the green buds float off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar walks up to the heavily crowded store entrance. We Sophina exiting holding a large cardboard cake box. Oscar takes it from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What flavor did you get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrot cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar looks at the cake box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you didn't get ice cream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause it aint your birthday nigga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you take me by my grandma's house so I can get changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You know it would be hella easier if you just had your stuff at my spot right. When you gonna move in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably when you stop having trees in the car before we pick up T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Oscar as he turns the corner into a backyard fu of toys and KIDS Tatiana's age. Mrs. Stacey watches them, smiling, but with vigilant eyes. Tatiana spots Oscar and up and gives him a hug. Oscar waves and smiles at Mrs. Stacey, who waves back. He walks over to the sign out sheet and grabs a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We played "Freeze Tag" today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They couldn't catch me. Oscar looks up from the sign in sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're faster than daddy? Tatiana looks back at Oscar challengingly. Oscar looks at something behind Tatiana with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that right there? Tatiana takes the bait- the oldest trick in the book. Osc takes off.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FIRST FRUIT LEARNING CENTER- DAY
dialogues.text: Oscar is beating Tatiana to the car by a mile. Tatiana follows him laughing loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cheated!

dialogues.speaker: INT. SOPHINA'S GRANDMOTHER'S HOUSE- KITCHEN- DAY
dialogues.text: A small television sits next to the stove playing a Telenovella. Looking at the episode from the kitchen doorway is MARIAN PANGELINA, Sophina's 65 year old grandmother. SIZZLING ca heard coming from the kitchen. The front door opens, and walks Sophina, Oscar, and Tatiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bisabuella!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hola Tatiana! Tatiana runs to Mariana and gives her a hug. Oscar gives her a kiss on the cheek. Sophina gives her a The three take a seat at the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mariana continues to cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma, can you watch T tonight? We gonna go to Frisco. Mariana shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Rose got hella kids to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what's the difference between watching six kids, and watching seven? Sophina think about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tatiana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quieres pasar la noche con sus primos? Tatiana nods. Sophina sighs, pulls out her cell phone, an heads out of the kitchen. Mariana turns to Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Oscar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... it's work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. Oscar thinks on this, exits the kitchen in the direction Sophina. Only Tatiana is left at the table. Mariana smile At her. She puts some pollo on a fork, and takes it over her.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SOPHINA'S CHILDHOOD BEDROOM- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: As Oscar enters, we see Sophina is in her bra and panties talking into her cellphone. She lays several different outfits out on the bed. Oscar closes the bedroom door, le on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright... We'll be through there at like 10.. She hangs up her phone, and tosses it on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose gonna watch T. She looks through the clothes on her bed and lifts up a checkered hoodie, puts it to her chest. Looks at herself full body mirror, sighs at her reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disinterested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sophina turns around and looks at Oscar, senses something eating at him. She puts the hoodie down, and walks over t him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? You been hella weird today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, I'm smooth. Just a little tired. Sophina's not buying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osc. Wussup? Oscar looks at her for a beat. Cuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it. (to Sophina)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost my job. Sophina looks at him like he's speaking another language. for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you mean? Did they lay you off? Oscar doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They doing cutbacks or some shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showin up late. Missed a couple days when I had to get some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told you today? Oscar waits a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it real, they fired me two weeks ago. Sophina's eyes get as wide as quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bad-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fucking my bad me Osc! What was you doin when you was pretending to go to work? You know what? I don't even want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was gonna be able to get my shit back. Sophina looks at him and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think life a fucking joke... You think you're gonna get fired and then somebody is gona give you thier job back? What world do you live in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phina,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aint shit, you know that? You lie to me, you lie to your fucking daughter. You don't give a fuck about us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have to tell you shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you would have just kept faking like you were going to work? And would have just been out bustin nocks? And doing whatever else, or WHOEVER else you do while I'm at work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you wanted the truth... But you ain't trying to hear that. Sophina doesn't know what to say to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to be honest with me. But off top. From the fucking jump. Not after you lie for two weeks get cornered, and don't have a choice. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you today. Hmm. I bet you sold that fucking zip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dumped it. I'm done with that shit. I'm tired. That's what I'm trying to tell you. Thought I could start fresh today. But that shit aint working out. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You threw it away? Oscar nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tossed a whole zip of weed. And you don't have a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar doesn't say anything. He smiles at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God I could slap you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophina hugs him, he doesn't resist this time. Hugs her b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know? Something legal. Gonna see if my sister can hire me again, while I look. Maybe if I can just not fuck up, for 30 days.. Oprah said that's all it takes to form a habit, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophina laughs, Oscar kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar looks at her closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really done with that shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better be. Don't make me have to do this shit alone, again. I don't know if I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar kisses her neck. Sophina reaches back and unhooks h bra. Oscar kisses her face, picks her up. Blue (6/13/2012)

dialogues.speaker: INT. SOPHINA'S GRANDMOTHER'S HOUSE- KITCHEN- DUSK
dialogues.text: Mariana and Tatiana sit side by side at the table, spellb by the Telenovella. Pink (6/25/2012)                                       46

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GRANDMA BONNIE'S HOUSE- PORCH- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Oscar, with Tatiana sitting on his shoulders, and a bag o crabs in his hand, walks up to the porch of a modest hous Sophina stands at his side holding a cake. Oscar uses his to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GRANDMA BONNIE'S HOUSE- ENTRANCE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: The three enter the house and walk through the house into kitchen. Wanda, wearing casual clothes now, fills up a pot with wa Grandma Bonnie washes a basin full of vegetables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday! Oscar takes Tatiana off her shoulders and sits her down. Everyone greets each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey baby. You guys are just in time. Oscar sits the crabs down on the counter next to the sink gives his mother a big bear hug. She smiles, hugs him bac just as tight. Oscar lets go and moves on to his grandmot Sophina and Tatiana come give Wanda hugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, you guys got a cake too? Sophina blushes. Everyone laughs at this... even Ceephus. Wanda and Grandma Bonnie begin to take the groceries out the plastic bag. Wanda pulls out two massive crabs. Looks the bag and sees the third.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osc. You know all I needed was two, you didn't have to spend so much money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't trip, it wasn't that much. Oscar turns from the kitchen into the den. Pink (6/25/2012)

dialogues.speaker: INT. GRANDMA BONNIE'S HOUSE- DEN- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Two men in their 50's sit down on the couch across from a playing ESPN. These are Oscar's uncles DARYL and CEEPHUS JOHNSON. Oscar walks over to a recliner adjacent to them pulls the Hallmark Bag out of his waistband. He sits down the recliner and signs his Mom's card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you goin for in the Super Bowl Unc? Oscar watches, and waits for them to take the bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steelers. Daryl shakes his head at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Raiders fan, cheering for the Steelers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black uniforms, black players, black coach. Coach even has a black wife. I'm going with the Steelers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're insane, you know that? Oscar cracks up at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanda and Sophina clean the crab with brushes and differe utensils. Grandma Bonnie starts up a roux in a large skil Uncle Daryl makes a large pitcher of lemonade from concentrate. Sophina and Oscar pull out glasses, dishes, utensils for everyone. Tatiana watches Oscar closely.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A large pot is placed atop the gas stove. The burner blaz under it, as Wanda drops the now clean crabs into the buc She drops in the vegetables and begins to stir. Bowls are grabbed by everyone and they are filled up by Wanda, with white rice first, and then the brown gumbo is poured over along with large pieces of un- cracked crab. Everyone eats their gumbo in the kitchen. Laughing talkin Wanda blows out the candles on her cake, cuts it, Hands o everyone a slice.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GRANDMA BONNIE'S HOUSE- DEN- HOURS LATER
dialogues.text: Everyone is finishing up their cake, it's about half gone now. Oscar sits on the couch between Wanda and Sophina. Ceephus and Daryl now sit in plush chairs with metal fram pulled up next to the coffee table. Grandma Bonnie sits i recliner at the foot of the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If somebody told me say twenty years ago, that I would live to see it happen, I'd have laughed in their face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If somebody would have told me that two years ago I would have laughed in their face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here we are. 2008 and its happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I think it's a sign of the times. The country is in bad enough shape for them to hand it over to a black guy. Look, if Bush hadn't have messed the country up so bad. Would he have even had a shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he still would have had a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But would he have won though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm happy the did win. If the country really is as messed up as you say, I think he's our best chance of fixing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep thinking about how much it means for T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was coming up, Teachers used to love to tell me, "You can be the President of the United States."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd make a great politician. You can talk your way out of anything. Sophina and Oscar share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'll never forget, in my fourth grade classroom we had this poster. It had all 40 some odd presidents on that thang. And I looked at all they faces. And it was all white dudes. At that point, I realized my teachers was lying to me. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A part of me aint believed what no teacher has said to me since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there will be a black face on those posters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let's let him get in there first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I still feel like it's just too good to be true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so good about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black man, one of us has been elected president, fair and square. Ceephus shakes his head at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's not one of us. He wasn't affected by slavery. Wanda has had enough of this. She stands up and starts to grab everyone's plates. She heads into the kitchen to was Oscar watches her for a beat, then follows after her. Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanda stands over the sink washing the dishes. Oscar stan next to her, drying them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your help tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Come'on Ma, don't mention it. You shouldn't even be doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I enjoy washing dishes. It's relaxing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Oscar rolls his eyes at this. She hands him another dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really enjoyed having you here. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's safe for me to get used to having you around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. I aint missin no more parties. She looks at Oscar for a long beat, searching for the tru in his eyes. She finds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys got plans for tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, nothing major. Gonna meet up with Cato, Jack, Jason and couple                       other cats. Head out to the City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys gonna go OUT OUT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. We gonna keep it low key. Probably just catch the fireworks, and then roll around after that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just chill, we'll be cool. Sophina's got work in the morning too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys gonna be drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they will. I'm not gonna be drinking. Wanda looks at Oscar, not buying it. Oscar laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you catch BART out there? That way you can drink and hang out, and not have to worry about anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah we might catch BART.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No traffic either. You know its gonna be crazy. Going and coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we might have to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me, if you and your friends go, you'll catch the train. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aight. Don't make me follow you guys to make sure... you remember Prom. Oscar laughs at this so hard he has to sit the bowl. He p out his phone and starts to text.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's catch BART out there. Tell everybody to meet at South Hayward Station. He presses send. He picks the dish back up, and dries it. phone buzzes. He look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aight bet. We'll see you there in minute. Pink (6/25/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar, Sophina, and Tatiana say their good-byes to Grandm Bonnie, and Uncle Daryl and Uncle Ceephus. Oscar walks up to Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright we out, Birthday Girl. Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you too, son. And Happy New Year. Oscar gives her a big hug and kiss, then turns and leads family out of the door. Wanda watches them, and shuts the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SOPHINA'S CAR- LATER
dialogues.text: Oscar drives through Hayward in silence, turning his whee Tatiana watches out of the backseat passenger window with solemn expression. She looks up at a bright flash of light in the sky. We se outside her window, a group of YOUNG TEENAGERS stand on a street corner and shoot off a Roman Candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar and Sophina sit in the front seat of the car. They look tired. They look back at Tatiana who continues to lookout of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to just call it a night? Sophina thinks about this. Shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering as well)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go to the city... It's been a minute since we been out together too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. They both get out of the car. Oscar grabs Tatiana and wal up to the house. He rings the doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSE, Sophina's 27 year old sister, sits on the couch in front of a small television. She wears sweatpants and a p T shirt. Sprawled out a pallate of blankets and pillows on the car are Rose's kids, (all Hispanic) Lala (8) Issac (6) twins Eilly and Angelo (5), Alena (2). The doorbell rings, and Rose gets up off of the couch and opens up the door. Oscar bursts into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year!!!! ARRRGHHHH!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Oscar!!!!! Rose's kids all jump up and growl back, mobbing Oscar, al smiles, clawing at his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna sleep over uncle Oscar? Oscar smiles at this, and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleeeaaaase mommy can Uncle Oscar spend the night? Oscar struggles for a bit, laughing, Tatiana jumps into t fray, helping her cousins tackle her Dad. Oscar, gives up laughing, and falls to the carpet. Rose and Sophina look on at this. Sophina laughs, Rose doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Osc, I just got them ready for bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, ok, ok. My bad. Stop you guys. Time out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys let your uncle up. The kids ease up on Oscar a bit. Oscar sits up, and looks Tatiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's brush those teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! She backs up smiling, and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want your teeth to rot? And your breath to smell like gumbo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Oscar looks at her seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't. Because then- THE

dialogues.speaker: GUMBO MONSTER WILL GET YOU
dialogues.text: Oscar quickly moves in for the attack. Tickling Tatiana a picking her up. Rose's Kids laugh and follow Oscar toward

dialogues.speaker: INT. ROSE'S HOUSE- BATHROOM- NIGHT
dialogues.text: It is a modest bathroom. Oscar sits Tatiana on a wooden s in front of the sink. Tatiana gets ready to place the toothbrush into her mouth stops. She looks up at Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had gumbo, too. Oscar looks back at Tatiana guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ROSE'S HOUSE- BATHROOM- SECONDS LATER
dialogues.text: Both Tatiana and Oscar stand side by side brushing their teeth, smiling while brushing. Oscar uses his finger. Pink (6/25/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar puts Tatiana into her pajamas. Sophina stands in th doorway watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys aren't gonna sleep over too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Mommy are gonna go see some friends for a little bit. We'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't want you to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be back, in a few hours I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you should go to bed. You already brushed your teeth. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. But me and Mommy promised our friends we would go and visit them. We'll be back before you wake up, okay? Oscar leans over and gives Tatiana a kiss on the cheek. H gets up and gets ready to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo! Don't go. She grabs his arm. Tears well up in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear guns outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are just firecrakers. You'll be safe inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about you daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be just fine. I'll tell you what, tomorrow when we wake up, we'll play "Candyland". And then guess what we can do after that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the park?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Toys R Us?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck e Cheese's. Tatiana cracks a gigantic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. We'll play all the games. And daddy's gonna give you lots of tokens okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And me and you are gonna eat up all the pizza okay? We're gonna even eat mommy's pizza because she can't have carbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a carb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about that. Oscar stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna head out now baby, okay? Tatiana pouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to go in there with your cousins?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tatiana shakes her head, still not happy about Oscar leav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. He kisses her on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you too Daddy. Oscar and Sophina leave the room. We hear them say bye to Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SOUTH HAYWARD BART STATION PARKING LOT- LATER
dialogues.text: We follow Oscar and Sophina as they approach a tough look group of 20 somethings. Among the group is Cato, Jason GR KRIS RAFFERTY, Brandon and Tim BRYSON, CARLOS REYES, and VANESSA RODRIGUEZ. Oscar approaches the group and greets everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yall ready? The group starts walking towards the BART turnstiles. Tal as they walk. Jason leans in and whispers to Cato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe these niggas brought they broads. Finna be hella work in Frisco tonight. Vanessa takes a Tea Bottle from Carlos, her boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna slow down? I'm not dragging your drunk ass all over Frisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)                                  65

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brandon leans in to Kris and Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Thousand Nine... don't even sound right bruh. But Twenty Ten? Twenty Ten is the year my nigga. We gettin it in, for Twenty Ten. See? Don't nothing even rhyme with Two Thousand Nine. Tim shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you said just rhymed, you dumb ass nigga!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man fuck that. I'm boycottin 2009 bruh. Come twelve o' clock it's officially Twenty- Ten. We "gettin it in" in Twenty- Ten. Kris thinks about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Twenty Twenty though? That shit hard as fuck. Two twenties. We "gettin' plenty" in twenty twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's skippin too many years bruh. You can't skip a whole decade. Brandon turns to Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osc, Osc! Take a shot with ya bruh for the New Year. Oscar smiles, takes it. Drinks a small shot, and hands it back to Brandon. Brandon lifts the bottle up at Oscar lik toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Twenty- Ten. He takes a quick swig. Oscar gives Brandon a "What the fu are you talking about" look. The group laughs at this, an follow Oscar's lead towards the station entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group enters through the turnstiles, sticking their tickets in and retrieving them as they pass through. They head up the stairs towards the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The San Francisco bound train is docked and a few passeng are still getting on to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stand clear, doors closing. Oscar runs up and stops the doors just as they are about close. He holds it while the rest of the group boards. Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar boards, the doors close, and the train takes off. H looks around and sees the car is packed with COMMUTERS. H moves through the crowd to the back of the car he pulls o the doors and the group enters-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar looks around and heads over to some standing room n to where DANAE a gorgeous Black woman in her late 20's si wearing a ball gown and leather jacket. Across from her sit KAREN and DONALD, a White couple dres in similar clothing. There is an empty seat next to Danae but Oscar, Sophina, Tim, Kris, Vanessa, and Carlos all re standing. Brandon, however, slides into the empty seat. H puts his arm around Danae's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you keep your hands to yourself... The group laughs at this. Danae turns and looks at Brando who is making a funny face at her. She can't hold in her smile. Brandon takes his arm down and offers her the bottle of Hennessy- she declines. He turns to Karen and Donald, and offers it. Donald opens his jacket and pulls out a flask. lifts it at Brandon, smiling. Brandon lifts his bottle in return. The both take a swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BART train zooms by above street traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few seats down from Oscar. Jason and Cato have found so company. LAUREN and ASHAE two super attractive Black girl their 20's sit next to each other. They pass a "Black and Mild" cigar back and forth. Cato and Jason hold onto the rails standing over them. Ca takes his joint from behind his ear, lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's illegal to smoke "Blacks" on BART right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right officer? Cato passes the lit joint to Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But its cool. We'll let you slide cause its New Years and all. Ashae looks up at Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your dreads. Jason passes her the joint. She takes it, puts her to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your everything. We should work something out. Ashae smiles and shakes her head as she takes a drag in. Lauren laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gay. Cato looks at them for a beat. He puts his arm around Jas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, we gay too. We can do the whole gay thing together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collaboration... It'll be fun. Lauren and Ashae laugh at this. Not buying it for a secon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yall not gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real shit... watch... Cato turns to Oscar, who is hugged up with Sophina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting across the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osc!! Osc my nigga!!! (motions to Jason)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aint we gay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yall niggas is Gay as Fuck! Everyone on the train laughs at this. Cato turns back to girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now approaching... West Oakland Station. The standing passengers brace themselves, as the train sl to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry folks, there's gonnna be a slight delay while we sort out an issue with this other train. Hands open connecting car doors from the other side, revealing DARIUS, a tough looking Back teenager wearing a hoodie and a colorful backpack. He is followed by two oth BLACK TEENAGERS- his friends. Darius makes eye contact wi Oscar for a long beat... lifts his head. Oscar lifts his head back, and looks down at his phone: I reads 11:55pm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gon miss the countdown bruh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We aint gonna miss shit, we can get it poppin right here. He presses a few buttons on his iPhone. It plays the MAC song "FEELIN MYSELF" he turns it up. Oscar's friends nod their heads to the music. Darius' face brightens up and he takes off his backpack, digs in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, bruh. He pulls some laptop speakers out of his bag, leans over Danae, and plugs the jack into Brandon's phone. The MAC D now pumps through the whole car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on lil bruh! More commuters start to dance, including Darius, and his friends, who move like professional "Turf" dancers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bay Bridge and skyscrapers are beautifully illuminate the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of hundreds of people are gathered on the pier overlooking the water. The group is mostly white though diverse in age: Teenagers, young families with kids in strollers, middle aged married couples, tweens. They check their wrist watches and cell phones periodical and look to the sky with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a party on BART. The train starts to move, and every CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, how we gonna do the countdown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use your phone bruh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My phone don't got no seconds. Oscar looks around the car, zeroes in on Donald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bruh, you got a watch? Donald holds up his left wrist and nods his head. Oscar t to Brandon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn the music off bruh!!! Brandon turns down the dial on the music. Blue (6/13/2012)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see what the crowd is staring at- A large old fashione clock on the side of the Ferry Building reads 11:58. The minute hand ticks to 11:59pm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar, Sophina and the other commuters are huddled around Donald, who is now standing up, watching the second hand on his watch, and waving his right finger like an orchest conductor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of faces look off into the sky with anticipation their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SIMULTANEOUS
dialogues.text: A CHILD, white girl about 6 years old, points to somethin the sky, she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clear sky except for a small gray spec that slowly approaches the center of frame and suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BOOM! The spec explodes into a dazzling cluster of red an blue fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: SIMULTANEOUS
dialogues.text: The crowd looks on with wonder, their faces illuminated b the fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAPPY NEW YEAR!!!!!!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pandemonium. Everyone on the car is going crazy. Bra turns on the MAC DRE again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy TWENTY- TEN!!! FUCK TWO THOUSAND NINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald gives Karen a peck on the lips. Lauren and Ashae k passionately, showing off. Cato and Jason record this wit their cell phones.

dialogues.speaker: SIMULTANEOUS
dialogues.text: The fireworks are dazzling. Now greens, blues, purples, a whites, all beaming brilliantly. The crowd cheers in amazement. An ASIAN COUPLE kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar holds Sophina close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year, Osc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now approaching Montgomery Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar and Sophina brace, as the train comes to a stop, al loosing their balance. They laugh at this. The doors open the group, along with the other passengers, exit the car. Goldenrod (7/19/2012)                                   7

dialogues.speaker: INT. MONTGOMERY STATION LOBBY- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: The group walks through the Bart Station Lobby, ahead A MUSICIAN sits in a chair playing an ERHU, a box full of dollar bills sits in front of him. As the group passes the Musician, Cato drops a dollar in hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigga, you could have gave that shit to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Learn how to play the guitar, and I got you bruh! The group steps onto an escalator, and we follow them up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group exits the BART station and walks out onto the Downtown San Francisco street. PEDESTRIANS are everywhere

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta find somewhere to pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go too. We loose the group into the crowd of pedestrians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod (7/19/2012)

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SAN FRANCISCO LIQUOR STORE- MOMENTS LATER
